website_summaries.verdict: The Energy Power Bar sounds better than most sound bars when playing music, but there are better overall sound bars available for less money.
pros: Music sounds surprisingly good on the  Energy Power Bar
The wireless subwoofer is compact, and the sound bar itself is easy to wall-mount with keyhole slots on the back
cons: The Power Bar sounds underwhelming when it comes to movies, especially for the price
You're also required to use your TV's remote to control the Power Bar, which can be problematic with some TVs

customer_reviews.title: Energy Sound Bar has very good sound but a few frustrations came with it
customer_reviews.text: I like the the Energy Power Bar and the sound quality is very good. It does not come with a remote control to adjust the volume. I had purchased a Harmony Universal Remote and it was not a model referenced for programming by Harmony. I had to designate it as a Samsung Sound Bar to program the Universal Remote. It also could not learn commands by pointing the remote at the soundbar

product_meta.title: Energy Power Bar Soundbar with Wireless Subwoofer (Satin Black) (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
product_meta.description:
The Energy Powera Bar instantly upgrades your sound system without requiring a receiver. Just plug in and stand back. The two-way soundbar houses two domed tweeters and two 3-inch drivers for clear, distortion-free sound reproductions. Those drivers are aligned in the exclusive Convergent Source Module (CSM). Unique to Energy speakers, the CSM technology places tweeters and mid-woofers in close proximity to act as a single source for coherent, seamless dispersion. The speaker effectively disappears, sonically. The soundbar comes complete with an 8-inch wireless subwoofer with a down-firing fiber composite cone and ported enclosure for precise, room-filling bass performance. Measuring 30-inches in length and exuding a contemporary look, the Energy Power Bar is the perfect companion for high-definition picture and a necessary substitute for underwhelming flat-screen speakers. The remote control learning feature allows the easy-to-install-and-use system to function via your existing TV controller. The Energy Power Bar is designed to quickly connect to most TVs without additional cables. An included digital optical cable connects to your TV's digital output and then to the back of the soundbar. For those few TVs without an optical audio output, there is also a 2-channel analog input (cable not included).The soundbar can be positioned on the included rubber feet on a shelf or stand or can be wall-mounted using the included easy-to-use mounting template.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


ENERGY POWER™ BAR
Forty years of audio research, development, engineering, and manufacturing has led to the creation of Energy’s latest line of speakers: the Energy Power Series. The products in the Energy Power™ Series provide simple audio solutions that instantly upgrade your sound system without a receiver. Just plug in and stand back. The power is undeniable.

The Energy Power Bar Difference

Introducing the Energy Power Bar, the brand’s first-ever soundbar. This two-way soundbar packs a mean punch, equipped with two domed tweeters and two 3-inch drivers for clear, distortion-free sound reproductions. The real difference in the Energy Power Bar comes from our proprietary Convergent Source Module Technology. This amazing innovation places the tweeter and mid-woofer in close proximity to act as a single source for coherent, seamless dispersion. Translation: huge sound that’s also acutely accurate.

Heart Pounding Bass

Every home theater needs a subwoofer. That’s why we include an 8-inch wireless subwoofer with a down-firing composite cone and ported enclosure. It’s the perfect companion to the Energy Power Bar and provides the thunderous bass that you feel as much as hear.

Simple Set-up

The Energy Power Bar couldn’t be easier to set-up because it was designed to quickly connect to most TVs without additional cables. An included digital optical cable connects to your TV’s digital output and then to the back of the soundbar. For those few TVs without an optical audio output, there is also a 2-channel analog input. You can also program your TV remote to work with the soundbar’s functions.

Pure Beauty

The Energy Power Bar measures 30-inches in length and boasts a contemporary black satin finish that will not only fit into your décor, but enhance it. The soundbar can be positioned on the included rubber feet on a shelf or stand, or can be wall-mounted using the included easy-to-use mounting template and built-in keyhole mounts. 

This easy-to-setup and use one box solution is the perfect companion for high-definition picture and a necessary substitute for underwhelming flat-screen speakers.

What's in the Box

One black satin finish soundbar, one 8” wireless down-firing subwoofer, one 1.5m optical cable, one pair of rubber feet, wall mounting template, and one owner’s manual

Technical Specifications 

 * Frequency Response - 50Hz to 20kHz +/- 3dB
 *  Power Handling - 200 watts peak
 *  Tweeter - Two .78" (20 mm) soft dome tweeters
 *  Midrange - Two 3" (7.6 cm) IMG drivers
 *  Subwoofer - One 8" (20.3 cm) down firing fiber composite cone / ported enclosure
 *  Inputs - 1 Optical input, 1 RCA input
 *  Mounting Options - Two built-in keyhole mounts for wall mounting
 *  Dimensions - Soundbar: 4.4” H x 30” W x 4.1” D; Subwoofer: 11.5” H x 9.5” W x 14” D (Dimensions include grille and feet)
 *  Weight - Soundbar: 5 lbs / 2.3 kg; Subwoofer: 15 lbs / 6.8 kg
 *  Finish - Soundbar: Satin Black; Subwoofer: Matte Black Vinyl
